| PR interval |  |

The PR interval is a measure of the time it takes for the heart to recover from each beat and is a component of the electrocardiogram (ECG). While not a disease itself, prolongation of the PR interval can be a sign of various cardiac conditions, such as heart block, bundle branch block, or sick sinus syndrome.
